issue.title: [Java] NullableDateMilliVector.getObject() should return a LocalDate, not a LocalDateTime
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-1984](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1984). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
NullableDateMilliVector.getObject() today returns a LocalDateTime. However, this vector is used to store date information, and thus, getObject() should return a LocalDate. 

Please note: there already exists a vector that returns LocalDateTime –
 the NullableTimestampMilliVector.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1984?focusedCommentId=16321156) by Vanco Buca (vancobuca):*
Similarly, NullableTimeMilliVector.getObject() should return a LocalTime

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-1984?focusedCommentId=16924322) by Yongbo Zhang (yongbo):*
I'm looking at this ticket.
